content: quote: When we have taken steps that have violated the Geneva Conventions we rightly have been criticized, so as we move forward I think it's important to again live our values, to live the agreements that we have made in the international justice arena and to practice those.
quote: When we have taken steps that have violated the Geneva Conventions we rightly have been criticized, so as we move forward I think it's important to again live our values, to live the agreements that we have made in the international justice arena and to practice those.
title: Who said it....

content: The source of the above quoote is General Petraeus. I believe he was speaking about closing Guantanamo Bay. First of all, I do not see the holding of enemy combatants as being, in and of itself a violation of the Geneva accords. Secondly, I am not aware of any plan the general may for the detainees once the facility is closed. The president already promised to close gitmo but was counting on support from "allies" that would take some of those prisoners off of our hands. How has that worked out?
reply: The source of the above quoote is General Petraeus. I believe he was speaking about closing Guantanamo Bay. First of all, I do not see the holding of enemy combatants as being, in and of itself a violation of the Geneva accords. Secondly, I am not aware of any plan the general may for the detainees once the facility is closed. content: quote: Originally posted by scooter_mech: The source of the above quoote is General Petraeus. I believe he was speaking about closing Guantanamo Bay. First of all, I do not see the holding of enemy combatants as being, in and of itself a violation of the Geneva accords. Secondly, I am not aware of any plan the general may for the detainees once the facility is closed. The president already promised to close gitmo but was counting on support from "allies" that would take some of those prisoners off of our hands. How has that worked out? Exactly...If the General is offering his opinion then he should offer a solution as well.. Personally, I think he is saying this under political pressure. He is stil a General who answers to civilian authority.

content: Personally, I believe the "wicket" of a General Officer is winning Wars and Conflicts...not involving oneself in partisan politics.. Other, Great Generals, have been reprimanded and discharged for the same...
